text: Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
On tap at ACBF2017. Pours hazy orange to amber, white head. Toasted malts, vague fruit, grainy, bread, caramel, very dry and moderately bitter finish. Medium bodied.

Keg at Bishops Arms in Malmo. It pours clear deep amber with a thick off-white head. The aroma is fresh, brown bread, rivita, toasty, earth, dried fruits and wood. The taste is soft, sweet, juicy, dried fruits, raisin, date, raisin, wood, toasted nut, leather and resin with a firmly dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Nice stuff.

Borefts Beer Festival 7th edition day 2 26/09/2015. A nice reddy amber coloured pour with a lasting cream head. Aroma is nutty malts, red berries, strawberry and mixed jammy fruits. Flavour is composed of semi sweet nutty malts, hins of cake and toffee, red berries. Jammy fruits. Palate is semi sweet, moderate carbonation. little chalky finish.

Draft @ Brouwcafé de Molen. Pours a clear amber beer with a medium sized, white head on top. Aroma of fresh citrus, oranges, caramel and not much else. Flavor is medium bittersweet, fruity and hoppy. Nice, light herbal characters, while softly carbonated and easily drinkable. Aftertaste is medium short, light sweet. Very nice to session this all day..

Toasted malty aroma and taste, some caramel , slight grassy, twiggy and herbal hoppy bitter finish.
Tasting @ Havregatan 20161028. Bottle (500 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty and fruity, grassy, hoppy notes, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and fruity.
Beer tasting @ Jorn69 28/10-16. Malty and fruity with metallic notes. Body is medium, the finish is dry, malty and bitter.
UPDATED: OCT 28, 2016 Bottle from systembolaget. Beer tasting@ jorn69. Pours a amber colour beer with a medium head. Some tropical fruits with malt. Dry finish.
Clearish copper with good head. Aroma light. Caramel and herbal notes. Taste carries aroma, with light caramel notes, herbal tunes and some subdued esters. Not a bad esb
Sampled at Borefts 2016, Bodegraven. Clean orange pour with a thin white head. Notes of caramel, dried fruit, metallic bitterness. Medium body, low carbonation and a bitter-sweet finish.
Tap. Brilliant copper color with tan head. Aroma is fruchtgummi, earthy hops. Taste is fruchtgummi, quite juicy, a bit earthy. Clean finish, slightly bitter. Brilliant Session beer.
Malzig herber, angenehm hopfiger Antrunk. Spritzig, die Bitterkeit steigt, wird aber zu trocken. Nett. 10/8/9/9//8
Fat @ Bishops Arms, Karlstad. Klar bärnstensfärgad med ett smutsvitt skum. Dofter av karamell, bröd, tall och örter. Smakinslag av karamell, citrus, krusbär och tall. Lätt oljig munkänsla.

On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Pours amber with a medium to little white head. Aroma is malty (biscuit, caramel), light fruity hops, grass. Flavour is a bit unbalanced, medium malt profile with a poor bitterness. Medium to light body, soft carbonation. So so...
Bottle 500ml. Medium brown with a dense light-tanned head. Plenty of caramel and burnt sugar. Malty aroma. Sweetish taste with some bitterness in the aftertaste. Nice ESB.
Excellent Handpump. Full bodied, Smooth minerally body, some lively texture. Very easy drinking. Just a pleasure of a beer to drink.

@borefts 2014
Veel caramel en veel broodigheid aangevuld met een zachte hoppigheid
Not bad, but I was not impressed. I did not like the sweetish bitter aftertaste, which to me was a bit medicinal. Had it on tap at 3 sma rum in Goteborg.
Tap @ Nordic. Pours slightly hazy amber, beige head. Caramel, toffee, nuts in the aroma. Nutty, caramel, sweet flavor.
Wunderbar in der Balance mit einer recht holzigen Hopfigkeit und einer ebenso erstaunlichen Frische. Leicht getreidigen, etwas Malz, dabei knackig und ausgewogen in der Bitterkeit. Gute Sache das.

Bottle fom trade with Nisse666, many thanks. The beer has got a clear deep amber colour with a low steady head and medium body. Aroma of hops and bread. Taste of hops, bread, straw, hay, citrus fruits, flowers and malt. Dry-bitter finsih. Good beer.
Cask at Oliver Twist Stockholm at 6.1 %. Small White head Dark amber color. Resin hop aroma with roasted malts. Roasted malt taste with sweetness and some fruit. Medium body.
From tap. Dark brown color with red notes and light beige head. Malty and hoppy aroma, caramel, bready, grassy, piney. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Appearance: Clear, medium brown. Some light tan head.
Aroma: Some malt, sweetness, light hops.
Taste: Nice malt, slightly roasted with a hint of bitterness. Nice.
Bought: Trade with Nisse666 - thanks!, 500 ml
Info: 1/1-2016, BB: 29/2-2016

Bra nästan vit men inte riktigt krona, blandade bubblor mest så små man ej ser som en hel krona av skum men några större, mörk siraps färg, doft av mörk sirap, aning karamell, knäckig aningen nån mörk frukt , smaken är väldigt lik, knäckig, maltig söt, mindre ton av humle beska i eftersmaken. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer pours hazy, copper-brown, with a two finger highe, fluffy, beige, head. 

Nose: Very fruity! Plum, dried fruit, raisin, apple, dark berries, caramel malt and fudge. 
Taste: Not as big as the nose but very subtile and great! Dry but still sweet. Dried fruit, dark bread, raisin and malt. 
Mouth: Medium body and carbonation. Sweet and dry ending. Great beer! 

Conclusion: A beer in a beatiful bottle with a personality. Deep, complex but still easy to drink. A beatiful beer paring with BBQ meat, christmas food etc.

On tap at The Bishops Arms Örebro, Örebro. Very dark amber with an off-white head. Malty, caramelly and moderate hoppy with some fruity and floral notes. Medium sweet, but very well balanced and easy to drink. Tasty bitter!
Bottle. Light bourbon color pour with a white head. Mild malty bouquet. Mildly bitter with lots of malty notes. Average body and mouthfeel.

500 mL bottle. Deep amber. Small white head. Smell is nutty and a little fruity. Bready with some light earthy and spicy hops. Taste is very bready with a hoppy brightness. Lightly sweet. Caramel lends a bit of richness. Well carbonated. Medium light. Very flavorful for a bitter. Excellent beer.
[9/25/15] Draught sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2015 in Bodegraven. Clear amber. Aroma of malt, caramel, toffee, butter. Sweet flavor with malt, caramel, toffee, drier finish. Medium-bodied.

(Närke Örebro Bitter) Tap at Borefts 15, at 6.3% ABV.
Deep red brown colour on the body, good sized head, with good density too and mopre than okay retention.
Aroma has caramel, malts, some light hops.
Taste also of caramel, floral notes, toffee.
Medium thin body, soft carbonation.
Easy to drink.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget, Kungsgatan Örebro. Deep amber with a nice compact tanned head, rich lacing. Sweet malty aroma, caramel, figs, wood. Smooth mouthfeel, mild carbonated. Mid-sweet and rich taste with a pleasant bitterness in the background, caramell, red apple, dried dark fruit, walnut, straw. Dry finish.

25/IX/15 - on tap @ Borefts 2015 (Bodegraven) - BB: n/a (2015-1289) Thanks to 77ships and the Israeli beer tickers scene for sharing todays beers!
Clear amber beer, creamy yellowish head, stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: sweet, malty, caramel, grains. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: fruity, bit sweet, some caramel, toast, bit nutty, pretty bitter. Aftertaste: sourish, dry, bitter, bit fruity, some apples.
Sampled at BBF, pours clearish amber with small white head. Notes are bread, light hop, English grain, and soil. Flavor had some light toffee, and brown ale like notes. Bitter finish. Bland but nice.

Gyllene rödbrun färg, stadig och tät skumkrona. Doftar sött av sirap, torkad frukt och malt. Även en gnutta frisk syrlig i doften. Fyllig smak av ungefär desamma, om än med en tydligare beska som framträder. Trevlig bitter!
Aroma is smooth with bread notes, mild hops and some nutty hints. Taste is a well balanced soup of toffee, caramels, earth and bread. Nicely bitter in the aftertaste. Great!
Flaska från SB. Mörkt brunröd med beige skum. Doft av karamell och barr. Trevlig lite söt smak av karamell med en bra beska.

Sweet, slightly coppery aroma. Smooth flavor, nutty notes. Medium-full body, medium carbonation. Nice.

Draft at omnipolls hatt
Brown red, off white head 
Aroma of bread, burned notes
Sweet, some bitterness. Taste dark bread.

Det är tragiskt att det ska ta mer än ett år att fatta ordvitsen Du blir vad du dricker - Örebro bitter. Jämtländskt hjärndöd, hade uppenbarligen varit mer korrekt i det här fallet. Bara det borde ge pluspoäng till Närke kulturbryggeri som levererar en mer än godkänd öl.
500 ml bottle at ölstugan Tullen lejonet Göteborg. Hazy brown with off white head. Caramel malty with bread and floral. Semi dry with low bitterness and medium carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2015 Draught. Almost clear deep amber liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of earthy hops, caramel, raw sugar, flowers, citrus and bread. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of toffee, earth, flowers and bread. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. A perfect bitter. True to style like nothing else. This is the truest to style beer Ive had in a long time. Närke is the shit! Extremely drinkable. Perfect for what it is.
On tap @ Ölrepubliken, Gothenburg. Amber body with a low white head. Caramel, hay, herbs.
Fat bishops örebro. Mahognyfärgad med vitt skum. Maltig, lätt knäckig doft. Fint bitter i smaken med viss fruktighet och hö. Mycket trevlig

From tap, clear copper with low fizzy head. Aroma with notes of caramel, dried fruit, some citrus and herbs. Taste is bitter with some sweetness, followed by a good malty body that leads to a nice bitter finish.
Draught att Tre Små Rum, Gothenburg. Clear amber with a offwhite head. Floral and fruity aroma. Hoppy and floral nice flavour. A really refreshing nice beer.
Caramel, floral, some diacetyl, a bit of leathery feel to it. Taste is light caramel fudge, vanilla, butterscotch, very well balanced, and great for the style.
At Borefts 2014. Orange red, small head. Caramel, herbs, sweet, and light bitter. Nothing special.

Draught. Deep amber to copper color. Thin lacy head. Sweetly floral and green grassy hop aroma with dark caramel and toffy, minor biscuity toast. Malty, slightly caramelly sweet flavor, quite strong and clean bitterness with minty/herbal late hop flavor. Medium body, caramelly-round texture with low texture.

Amber with off white head - Malt aroma with hints of caramel, with a good hop aroma - Good mlat to support a nice hop bitterness - Finish starts with malts and ends with hop bitterness - This was good

Keg at BBF 6, 27/09/14.
Clear chestnut brown with a decent beige covering.
Nose is toffee, dark fruits, bitter tunes, caramel.
Taste comprises mellow dark fruit vibes, toffee, light spice.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a bitter edge.
Decent well balanced ESB.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Clear brown. Nice sweet, fruity malty aroma. Flavour is quite floral and dry witha dry hoppiness. Classic strong bitter.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2014 Sampled at Borefts Beer Festival 2014. THX everyone for sharing todays beers.
Clear amber beer. Nose is very sweet and malty. Taste is quite sweet with some hop bitterness.
Shared sample at bbf. Poured a dark amber to light Brown colour with a off head. Grains, some malts, toffee, herbal notes, pine hops, orange Peel, ok beer
Sampled draft @ Borefts 2014. Thank you! Dark brown amber, little tanned head. Mineral, iron, herbal, grass, caramel. Taste is bitter, oily, caramel, grain, orange, grass. Decent, enjoyable beer.

At BBF14 . 
Pours clear amberbrown . Small white head . smell is caramel, grainy . Bit sweet, herbal bitterness . Taste is straight bitter , bit bread . Grains .
sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2014: Kuperfarbenes Bier mit wenig weißem Schaum. Geruch nussig, malzig, muffig. Geschmack nach Karamell, hopfig, bitter.

On tap @ Borefts 2014. #6.
 Body is clear, flat, ruby red,
 Head is small, creamy, off-white, mostly diminishing, excellent lacing.
 Aroma is hint of caramel, light roasty, herbs, soap, vegetable.
 Taste is light sweet, medium bitter.
 Finish is light bitter with average duration.
 Medium body, oily texture, soft to flat carbonation. Tasty dessert beer, not too exciting, but good one.

From tap at 3 små rum in Gorhenburg 11.09.14. Dark copper. Dense and persistent beige head and lacing. Aroma of caramel and fine hops and grass. Similar well-balanced taste. Similar full and malty taste, very well balanced with hops. A superb example of my favourite style.

No tap @ Haandfest 2014. Looks good this. A deep golden slightly blurry body with a small sidesticking beige head. Caramel nose with tones of fresh fruits and a nice sweet toffee tone. Quite inviting aroma. Lots of flavor. Its perhaps a bit light, not directly watery but light in the mouth and the carbonation level is soft. Not to caramel oriented in the taste really. More dry-ish. Some red berries with a wild expression. Moss perhaps? Its easy to drink but not a way too memorable one overall. 24.05.2014

Man ska ta sejdeln dit man kommer och på besök i Örebro är det bara att tappa upp något humlat från Närke Kulturbryggeri. En tradition som jag inte har några som helst svårigheter att ta till mig. Den går rätt in i kroppen och snart har jag det i blodet. Öl är kultur och mångkultur betyder många olika öl. Så skål för det mångkulturella samhället!
Keg at Schouskjelleren. Pours amber, quite juicy and fruity, sweet toffee, bitter.

Draught @ Haand Ølfestival 2014
Pours clear amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain, caramel, floral and orange. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long malty and caramel finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
50 cl stadsträdgården. Kul med en riktig bra öl från Sveriges framsida! Stolta Örebro!

17.04.2014, tap @ Bishops Arms Vasagatan:
Small creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet grassy, caramel malts, grass, nuts, sap, leafs, hops, toffee, hints of licorice and butterscotch. Taste is mild grassy, hops, caramel malts, grass, leafs, sap, nuts, toffee, butterscotch, hints of pine needles and paper. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Draught at Pikkulintu. Dark amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, caramel, hops, a bit of soapy aroma and mango. Bitter finish with hops, caramel and citrus. Very nice ESB, although the faint soap aroma bothers me a bit.

The aroma is fruity. The taste is even beginning with sweet but quickly turns into a visitors fruitiness. Eftersmakens bitterness remain a little while. Okay beer but not much more. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Drank as a draught at a bar. Soft, smooth and well made bitter. Very good actually. Looks good too.
On tap @ Bishops Arms Gustav in Malmö. Caramel with some hay and a gentle bitterness. This is a good one.

Tap at the Bishops Arms (Gustav Adolfs Torg) Malmo. Poured a clear dark amber with a frothy white head and some broken lace. The aroma is weak hoppy malt leading to medium bitter flavour with a smooth almost creamy hop bitter palate and a long bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. This is really one of the best ESBs Ive had. It looked great and tasted even better. The hop combination was perfect. Served a little cooler that it should have been but that made little difference.The Swedes are showing the Brits how to brew an ESB!
0,25l on tap @ Pikkulintu. Pours clear amber with a medium head. Aroma and flavor are malts and fruits with some hops in the finish. Decent.

How: Draught.
Where: Bishops Arms (Bellmansgatan), Stockholm.
Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Sweet, hops, grass, caramel.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Bitter, hops, caramel, sweet, fruit. Very bitter finish.
On tap at Biercab. Clear copper colour with small white head. Caramel and fruit, hop aroma. Caramel, malt and hop taste, bitter. Light to medium body.
Draught at Oliver Twist. Dark copper / light red color, off-white head.Aroma of fruits, bitter and flowers. Taste bitter, fruity and lightly hoppy. Nice carbonation, medium body.
Delicious honey smell and Taste. Perfect on friday after work. Even the colour is tasteful.
Ljusbrun med litet skum och mycket malt men även lite humle i doften! Desto mer humle i smaken!

Nutty caramel, toffee and earthy green hops. Medium light body, somewhat bitter, dry, feels a bit tanninic. Nice caramelly nutty bitter. A bit harsh in the finish.-- bb/wp8

Aroma: The smell is fruity, pears, apples, malty, bread and nuts, and distinct hops.Appearance: Somewhat hazy dark amber, nearly brown color on the beer, a beige head leaving lacing.Taste: Upfront sweet, raisins and dark bread, then oranges and lemons and a good concluding bitterness,Palate: Medium high carbonation, a rather complex feeling, a dry finish.Overall: A good balanced and rather complex beer.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2010-07-31.
On tap. Clear amber brown with tiny white head. Aroma faint, of malt, grain, toffee. Flavor is malty, grain, toffee with some acidic notes. Decent

Pours a lovely deep, clear reddish amber with low off-white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, bread, some light citrus. Taste is lightly bitter and very fresh with a light bitter lingering finish. Medium bodied and creamy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Akkurat. Pours a beautiful redbrown color witha big and creamy off white head. Aroma has got notes of berries (strawberries?) and yeast. Its fresh. Taste is crisp and hoppy. Notes of citrus, elderflowers, reisin and strawberries. Slightly dry. Easy to drink.
UPDATED: APR 25, 2014 Draught at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is clear copper with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, sweetness, honey, toffee and malts. Too sweet for me.
Tap at pikkulintu, helsinki. Clear reddish brown color, small white head. Very light malty aroma, almost unnoticed. Malty body, hops, some fruits, citrus, dry finish. Decent bitter.

Draught. Pours amber in color with a fluffy whitish head. Fruity and malty in aroma, some light nuttyness. Same light nuttyness combined with some english butterscotch as well. Dry, bitter and slightly fruity finish.

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100805.
Pours copper color with a medium head. Aroma of fruits, hops and caramel malts. Flavor of hay, malts, caramel and fruits.
Frisk och lagom bitter. Smak och doft av malt, blommig, nötig, toner av honung och blå bär. Trevlig beska.

Drucken på fat på Bishop Gustav. Bärig doft och när den blir varmare växer bröd, karamell och mandeltoner fram jämte frukten. Tänker på en kladdig toscakaka. Munkänslan är len, mjuk och smaken fyllig och rik på smaknyanser. Bären finns där björnbär med drag åt smågodis, toscakakan, karamell, nybakt bröd, en liten men växande beska. Välbalanserat. Ett mycket trevligt öl som känns som en bitter där alla smaker skruvats upp och vävts samman på ett perfekt sätt.

Pours super clear copper brown with a large off white head. Nose is caramel, floral bouquet and English toffee. Taste is well balanced bittersweet right on par for the style. The. Mouthfeel is creamy yet has some bit as well. The body is medium and the finish is long. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Röd brun, färgat litet fast skum. För mycket folk runt, anteckning om doft annan gång. Var ett tag sedan jag tog denna min gammla standard öl sist nu. Smaken "rökigare" än vad jag minns, det tar över andra smaker nu, hoppas på bättre nästa gång. Denna brukar vara jämn i smak annars. Smak: rök, bränt socker, fikon, mineral toner, mörk kakao. Har jag ändrat smak så mycket sen jag tog den sist? Smakar inte som jag minns.

The pour is a clear amber color with a finger of dense white head.  Awesome nose of caramel, toffee, toast, and bread.  Very doughy with some nice earthy and floral hops.  Very good flavor, too.  Tons of bread, toasted malt, toffee, and a light caramel sweetness.  Very soft bitterness on the finish with some floral and earthy hops.  Everything in the beer works well together.  Excellent stuff.

Draught @ Olutravintola Konttori
Pours a nice mahogany colour with almost white head - unusual appearance for a bitter. Aroma is sweetish with caramel, toffee, some nuts and hints of resin. Flavour is sweetish in american way. It has caramel, hops, some toffee and resin. Too sweet for my taste but not bad still. An ESB in american way.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2012 Draught at Bishops Arms, Ørebro. Dark brown colour with ruby hues, and a small, white head. Aroma with malts, English style hops, and a hint of fruitiness. Taste is light sweet, with a subtle hop note. Medium body with a slick texture. Finishes lightly bitter with some fruitiness. Nice and well balanced bitter.
Amber colour with a white head. Malt and hopps in the nose. A bit flat due to low carbonation. Light citric hoppy and some caramel malt.[On tap at Bishops Arms in Malmö, Sweden]

Backlog spring 2011, bottle at Olympen, Oslo.
Golden color, ok foam.
Medium body & complexity.
Distinct bitterness( but it was lunch on a sunday)
Enjoyable

Cask, Bishop Arms, Malmo.
Nose: cheap pasturized orange juice, rubbing alcohol. Smells like gingivitis--reminds me quite a bit of a regular at a bar I used to work at, this English guy with loose teeth who drank Screwdrivers constantly.
Mouth: actually not bad, not as offensive as the nose. Fairly balanced, with hyacinth notes and lots of sweet, bright alcohol aromas, almost like bisongrass vodka. Dark, clean hops on the finish.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2014 cask at the Bishop Arms Savoy in Malmo, Sweden. soft, supple, delicately creamy texture with clean dishsoap sud esters and chewy black cherry dark malt.  old, red apple flesh, medium+ bitterness matched to the body; prickly, lively, active hop presence. rigid and firm malt suits the low carbonation. dry peach fuzz esters develop with time, and some mouthwash and toothpaste / mint notes are present as it warms but never too strong to ruin whats a fantastic bitter served in good shape.

On tap at Haand beer festival 2012. Amber colour with a very small white head. Hoppy aroma for a bitter, but this could be because this beer is actually an ESB. Notes of some citrus as well as hints of boiled vegetables. Flavour is dry and bitter. Notes of hops, maolts and caramel.

tap @ Haand festival.
Pour clear slightly nutty brown, with a small white ring as head.
Aroma is very balanced of hops and malt. Well balanced indeed.
Taste is a little sweet, with a slight bitterness.
Average body, with an average carb.

Cask. Darkish amber with a lasting head and some lacing. Good citrussy orange aroma. Plenty of that in the taste along with deep caramel notes. Very nice bitterness on the tongue. Moves through some very interesting phases in the mouth. Whilst I enjoyed this Swedish take on an English style, my tastebuds were often left a bit confused. I guess thats partly down to the addition of hop types Im not used to in a bitter. Not the fault of the beer then, which is a great interpretation of the style.

Cask @ Machesietevenutiafa. Copper color, clear appearance, white head; good lacing. Very, very weak aroma, i dare say. I could get some really good nutty, hoppy presence but i had a lot of difficult to notice something actually On the palate was a completely different story: pine, hop, a little bit resin, a lot of maple (syrup), oak, nut, malt. Quite  (for the style) bitter taste and finish. the drinkability of this beer is infinite, which gives some addition score to the rate.

Ar: very British, hoppier though. Yeast, bread, smoked malts, pine, resin, perfume.
Ap: Deep amber, White head, lots of lacing.
F:full flavoured and full bodied, lots of malts, and smoked malts at that, big bite with resinous notes, pine, grapefruit, perfume and some hints of coffee.
M: full bodied.
T: Very impressive!
Draught at Bishops Arms, Örebro. Pours brown, with a small brown head. Smells nutty, abit fruity and raisins. Tastes very bitter, abit creamy with a similar finish.

Draught @ Bishops Arms: Örebro on November 26. Pours copper brown with a thick grayish brown head that dissipates while leaving lots of trace on the glass. Smell is malty with caramel, sweet fruit and some resin. Taste is very malty with a lightly smoked character. Theres tar, resin, some minerals and metal. Finish is malty sweet and bitter.
For a bitter (not my favorite style) this is better than average.  The richness of the hop profile sets it apart from its English relatives.  Still, the wateriness is unfortunate
Clear color, dark copper, small white head. Aroma has barnyard, sugar, branches, pine, herbs, english yeast and some sawdust. Taste is more neutral but equally enjoyable..Good balance.

On tap. Brown with very small head. bitter and fruity, more than a hint of syrup in the flavor. The alcohol is also apparent; it reminds me a bit of a german doppelbock, but less intense in sugar. A hint of yeast, and a good deal of roast oats.

@ borefts festival 2011 starting my 2nd day wiht this to cure my hangover LOL 
Head: none 
Colour: amber 
Smell: sweet, malts, oranges, citric, pale ale 
Taste: bitter start, peels, grapefruit, malts, toasty, barley, dry end

Tap @ Borefts Beer Festival. Pours dark amber, small egg-shell whtie head. Aroma is bready and caramel malts, english yeast notes, grassy hops, apples and a bit doughy. Taste has a decent bitterness, bready and crusty malts, english yeast notes. Ends a tad dry. Very plain, but very well crafted.

Draft @ 3th Borefts 2011. A clear dark amber colored beer, with a beige head. The aroma of carmelmalts with some hop notes. The taste of hop bitter with fresh fruits, some sweet. The aftertaste is bitter for a long time.

Sampled at Borefts Beer Festival @ De Molen, Bodegraven. Dark copper / light red color, off-whiet head. Smell fruits, bitter and flowers. Taste bitter, fruity and lightly hoppy. Nice carbonation, medium body.

Draft @ Borefts Festival 2011, Bodegraven NL. Deep gold to orange colour with a decent sized off white head. Smells hoppy, bitter and orange (peel). Tastes hoppy, bitter and fruity. Good carbo, medium body.

On draught at the Boreft Beer Festival, 2011. Pours a golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma of pine and grapefruit with similar flavours. Mildly bitter and a little thin. Mild carbonation and CO2 prickle. Fairly hoppy.
Draft @ Borefts Beer Festival, 2011. Pours clear amber copper with a stabl creamy head. A bit of peach and grass. Dry, bitter and refreshing hop flavor. Clean.

Tap @ Borefts Beer Festival. Pours dark amber with an off white head. Aroma is forresty piney, hops, light organic, sawdust, hay and english yeast. Taste is pine, malts, light caramel, hay, earth leading to a dry end.

Orange beer, head haves a good size, just could hold a bit longer. Nice citrus, slightly caramel decent hoppy smell. The bittering at the end and slightly earthyness with a nice dryness is pretty well combined.

Amber coloured ale, medium creamy head. Very nice malty base with raisin, leaves, cane sugar, mango... Well balanced taste and lots going on too. Perfect mouthfeel. High quality brew for sure. (At Borefts)
Aroma of hops, apple. Taste is hoppy with apple and malty taste. Bitterness is quite mild. Not bad. But not very stronge
Cask @ Akkurat, Stockholm. Clear dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 090711

@Ölrepubliken
Smell: Berries, viola
Taste: Earthy, dark bread, viola, berries, grapefruit
Mouthfeel: Medium body, some nice bitterness.
Notes: Its the best bitter Ive tasted, quite refreshing, great session beer.

Courtesy of askofficerfriendly. Bottle pours clear deep copper with nice tan head. The aroma is roasted malts, spicy hops and faint earthiness. The taste is full rich yumminess with rich spicy hops followed by lesser amounts of earthy hops and roasted malts that seem to create a mild black tea sensation. This is much more a Pale Ale or IPA than a bitter but it taste so amazing, who cares?
On tap. It has a dark colour with a no great froth even not persistent. Malt aroma, grass and hop. Caramel taste in the finish. Very good.

On tap at Bishops Arms in Sundbyberg, June 2011.

Dark amber with a small white head. Aroma and taste of nuts, caramel, grape and some grass. Very refreshing and drinkable. The finish was bitter. A good one!
Draft at Tre Små Rum.  Pours amber with light head.  Fruit and caramel in the aroma .  Creamy flavor with some bitterness and a touch of malt.  Soft carbonation.  (Rated 2011/04/16)
Draught. Reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma: fruity, malty, some nuts. Taste: toffee, nuts, citrus, just a hint of licorice, some berries, balanced bitterness. Medium-bodied. Very drinkable.
To be written, just writing stuff to make this comment box turn green... come on!

Tasting@Ölrepubliken 110531. Örebro Bitter. Pour clear ryby mahogany tanned creamy head nice lace. Aroma is fruity, malty, bready, citric, caramel, not so distinguished. Flavor is very malty, dlightly roasted, caramel, fruity, citric and bitter. Very nice bitter malty finish.

Thanks to askofficerfriendly for the share.  Pours clear amber with an off-white head.  Nose is some malt, tobacco, some grassy hops, and a bit of yeast.  Flavor is similar with some dry notes in the finish.  All in all a nice, medium-bodied bitter.

Draught.
Deep copper, white head.
Malty nose, caramel, hops, plums, and a slightly burnt note which puts me off a bit.
Dry, medium bodied, high bitterness.
Malty, hoppy taste, lots of apricots, grapefruit, caramel, yeast, quite spicy. (2011-04-06)
Pours dark amber with a beige head. Aroma is malt, grass and pine hop, and fruity notes. Flavour is malt, grass, flower and earthy hop.

I had this from a bottle and a keg at Narke with Hans into a Narke tulip.

The beers a really nice dark copper with a hint of dark orange. There is a tope head that rises about two fingers with good retention and thick lacing...The aroma is similar to most esbs, a very sweet slight alcoholic bitter throughout, not a ton of sweetness to balance it out, but not sure if its needs it really...The taste is better than the aroma, light sweet to start and a light bitter through your sip with a very strong bitter finish several seconds after you swallow.

This is the most popular Narke making up a third of production. I think it is very good, not their best though. Its worth trying but but for a drinker Id go with CAmarillo.

On tap at Tre Små Rum. Very dark red, low white head. Does not look like your typical Bitter, but I still think it looks good. Aroma of exotic fruits, taste of raisins, some sweetness, and down the glass I sense some grapefruit like taste. Very good bitterness, with a hint of caramel as well in the ending. I have to say Im very surprised by this in a positive way. If we had had more time in Gothenburg Id have several more of this.
Tap @ Tre små rum. Murky ruby red, thin white head. Smells of cherries, mango, exotic fruits. Wow. Taste is not very sweet but balances out. Finish is bitter bitter with good hops. Good finish
Draught @BBF 2010. Although this isnt my favorite style, its a nice representation - hops come through end game. Nice.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2011 Draught.  Clear mahogany/chestnut, egg white Creamy (looks like a Guinness head) head that leaves lovely lacings. Aroma is malty with butterscotch and a nice hoppiness. Taste is roasted, butterscotch, fruity, caramel and resiny earthy hops. Bitter, fruity and hoppy. Very flavourful, rich and classy. Really nice.
On tap at Patricks. Red amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is dry, hop, malt, grass. Flavour is dry, hop, malt, grass. Medium body. OK beer.
Hoppy, bitter, bit watery, easy to drink (a lot of), nothing offensive, nothing very special.

Sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2010. Pours a clear and dark amber beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is weak, malt and hops with citrus. The flavor is malt and hops with citrus. The palate is bitterness. Overall a good beer.
tap at mikkeller bar. Cloudy red smooth offwhite head. Nice hoppy and  floral hoppy, faint licorice like aroma. 7  flavor is hoppy, dry, faint exotic fruity, faint sweet flowery malty.

Draught @ Pikkulintu

Pretty good bitter with a nice, almost ipa-like hoppy taste.
Tap @Pikkulintu 7.11. Poured mahogany color with a thin head. Aroma is fruity hoppy. Flavor is similar, very bitter. Very London Pride like, but more bitter. Excellent ESB.
Smaken ganska nötig, småsöt med inslag av plommon, en aning tung och nästan lite åt BW-hållet. Men trevlig var den så absolut.

Draft at Lompa (Olympen) Oslo , Norway. Dry and bitter indeed, but in a good way. Amber. Light.  Heavy flavors of moist cellar, some hay, flavours of vague smoke and/or some woody buisness as well, and in general bitter berries. Mild and sour.
On tap at Olympen, Oslo. Interesting brew with an unusual complexity for a bitter, yet typical bitter character in the finish.

Tap at godagens/örebro

Unfortunately I didnt take down good tasting notes beyond the numbers for this one!

On tap @ 2nd BBF. The aroma has grassy hops, some malt. Clear, golden coloured beer with a thin, white head. The taste is bitter, grassy with a little citrus and malts. Refreshing beer. Light-medium bodied. Good.

Head is just a small beige ring. Amber body. Fruity nutty caramel aroma with perfumy vanilla notes. Very harmonic. Dry perfumy roasty vanilla taste with spicy cinnamon notes. Light body. Mild mouthfeel. Dry perfumy cedar wood aftertaste with fruity dusty notes. Unusual. Subtle and harmonic. (0.33l draft, Håndverkerstuene, Oslo.)

Tap at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden. Nice amber colour and a very pleasant taste with a good amount of bitter in the onset but leaves little aftertaste compared to many others. As an added bonus the brewer himself was there that night.
At Borefts Bier Festival 2010. Dark orange colored brew. Aroma is a bit hoppy. Flavor has English hops, good bitterness. Nice bitter.

Draft @ BBF. Aroma is faint fruity hops, some yeast.
Flavour is seemingly English hops, with a proper malt backing.

text: Sample at SBWF 2010. Dark brown pour. Very nutty and earthy flavor, some wood. The EKGs are very present and the cascade provides more of a twist to it.
Tap @ 2nd BBF. Hint of caramel in the aroma. Caramelly flavor with earthy grassy notes. Very well balanced ale.

Tap at 2nd BBF @ De Molen. Beautiful coppery color with a perfect creamy off-white head. Great malt base, perfect balance. What a full flavor for such a low ABV brew. Would love to have this everyday.
Tap @ Monks Porterhouse. Clear brown color, short head. Lovely hop aroma, bit fruit, some toasted malt. Decent bitter taste. Great brew.

Draught at The Bishops Arms, Malmö, Sweden.
Reddish dark amber colour with big creamy off-white head.
Fruity bitter aroma with dark fruits and some swetish cognac/brandy notes.
Dark bitter resiny flavour with malty body. Low carbonation. Quite strong bitter aftertaste.

(Tap @ Gastropub Nordic, Tampere. Rated @ 7.8.2010.)
Nice red colour with a creamy head. Peaches, grapefruits and apples on the nose - very fruity and not that much malt on the aroma. Dry hops dominate the taste and create a nice bitter finish. Medium body, creamy texture and soft carbonation. Nice bitter.

Pours in a fantastic crimson red color. Big beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, fermented fruits, some earthiness, blossom honey, vanilla and rosé wine, Taste is sort of mildly sweet and round with balanced bitterness. It has a little smokey character, together with wood. Also I get this "red" flavours like lingonberry, cranberry and hibiscus. Quite light body and very drinkable.
all in all a shorter version of dark horizon 2nd ed. everything about this brew is scaled down somewhat compared to dh2, but its still a very good beer

Tap at Bishop Arms, Karlstad. Aroma is caramel, butterscotch, floral. Color is dark brown with a reddish hue. Taste is similar to the aroma with a good bitter aftertaste. Medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter.

On tap at Bishops Arms, Avenyn, Gøteborg. Pours deep brown/copper with a smal tanned head. Nice nutty aroma, dark caramel. Taste is more on the bitter side, with hints of grapefruits,but a good caramel base supports this well. Really good beer.
6th June 2010. On tap at Brasserie 4:20. Lightly hazy dark amber beer. Little cream head. Light semi dry palate. A little toffee in the malt. Fresh and aromatic hops. A little spicy. Not bad.
On tap at 4:20, RBESG Rome. Amber colour, white head. Aroma of grassy hops and toasted malts. Flavour is soft, toasted malts, caramel, good grassy and floral hoppy bitter finish. Medium bodied.

AR: fudgy caramel, wee roasted malt, 
AP: amber, frothy beige head
F: thick fudgy caramel, red fruits, medium + bitternes, doft carbonation, roasted malt, dry new rating 3,7 old 4,1 - change to 3,7!


On tap, 2010-03-17, "3 små rum", Göteborg
AP: dark brown body, medium high white head

Firm offwhite head. Clear, reddish-amber body. Peachy and appely fruit aroma. Taste is more fruity than malty. Apples again, faint citrus, also some crisp, dry malts in the background. Moderate hop flavor, yet a a well prononced hoppy bitterness. Medium to light body. Slick in the mouth. A slight fruity acidity and a fine, lingering bitterness in the finish.

On tap at Bishops Arms in Stockholm. 
Pours an hazy amber with a tan head. 
Aroma is very malty and fruity with weak notes of hops. 
Flavour is very fruity with malty notes and citrus, hoppy hints.

Draught at Bishops Arms, Stockholm. Amber body with a medium steady off white head. Malty aroma with light hoppy notes and lots of fruit. Flavour is fruity, with some caramel, citrus and flowers. Nice.

draft @ Tre Små Rum.
pours copper, thin beige head.
arome, caramel malt profile.
taste, hoppy, light bitter floral palate followed by malts, roasted and light chocolate.
UPDATED: JUN 16, 2009 Tap at the Rover. Dark coloured with small head. Fruity and round flavour, not very stron falavour.
Tap @ The Rover. Dark amber with barely no head. Fruity hoppy aroma, quite weak, a bit yeasty. Very low carbonation, which is good for me, grapefruity, balanced. Thats all.

Tap at Bishops Arms in Stockholm. Poured a dark hazy amber liquid with a small foam and some lacing. Had a smell of grasy hops and a hint of citrus. Had a fresh taste of grasy hops and some grape fruit.

On tap at Akkurat in Stockholm. Beer poured a cloudy amber body with a huge, massive while head that gives the effect of an ice cream float. The top looks like a baseball submerged in my beer but luckily it didnt taste like that. There was a nice citrus, hop aroma. The taste had a nice malt presence but also a refreshing citrus hop bite as well. Filling body and overall well rounded taste. My first Narke and hopefully not my last.
Draught (Svenska Dagar 2008 @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki) - Copper brown in colour. Fruity and hoppy aroma with some grain. A well balanced hoppy and malty taste. Pretty unremarkable but enjoyable enough.

Draught (Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Swedish Days 2008)
Served a bit cold, let it sit a while to warm up. Stodgy grainy aroma. Milky body. Pleasant hops and malt, well balanced. Very full-bodied. Fairly simple, but what’s there is tasty.

Tap SB&WF-08 - Unclear copper amber colored beer with a rich dense head. Grapefruit aroma dominates with notes of , caramel and typical swedish grassy hops. Flavor is very hoppy with a smooth clean mouthfeel to it. Finish is rather bitter and dry. Could have been a little bit more balanced.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2010 (Re-rate, draught at Pikkulintu) Poured deep amber and clear. Head was dense and white. Aroma had toffee, hops and malts. Palate was medium bodied with high carbonation. Flavours were malts, sweetness, hops, fruitiness, toffee and bitterness. Aftertaste was mildly sweet and clearly bitter. I didnt remember this was so sweet but it didnt bother me. Nicely balanced, solid body and clean taste. Good.

Old rating: 7-3-8-3-13=3.4

From tap at Akkurat, Stockholm. Very very good indeed. Dark ruby red with white long lasting head that in itself tastes like heaven. A nice fruity hoppiness, grapefruit and other such citric flavours. The beer itself is also full of all kinds lovely: lots of malty caramell, butterscotch and different kinds of fruit and berries. Hops to die for, both the citric and fruity aroma hops and the bitter hops in the finnish.
Draugth at One Pint Pub. Red-amber with no head. Fruity and hoppy aroma. More malty taste but with a nice hoppy finish. Noticeably carbonated. Very drinkable.

Draught at SOPP 2008, Helsinki. Amber color with small head. Perfumed and candyish hops in the aroma. Caramelly, biscuity, toffeish, worty and fruity flavor with bittersweet finish. Fairly chewy and worty, tastes a bit unfermented.

Draught @ [ Den Tatoverede Enke, Copenhagen, Denmark ].Clear medium to dark amber color with a average, creamy, good lancing, fully lasting, light beige head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, caramel, berry - strawbeery jam, moderate hoppy, pine, grapefruit. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (130608)

On tap @ Bishops Arms, Karlstad 08/06/26. This is a favourite of mine, Ive never tasted anything better in this particular style. The aroma is fruity, hoppy and nutty. Some pine needle? Taste is even better; nuts, some caramel, extremely good grapefruit/citrus bitterness which remains a long time after the beer is finished. Behind all this you can imagine a slight note of sweet berries like raspberries and wild strawberries. Overall this is great stuff, you can feel the craft behind this beer.

Tap in Suuret Oluet (Great Beers) in Lahti 4.7. Very balanced delicious bitterness with honeyish malts. Light copper slightly hazy with a HUGE beige head. damn good! a bit watery. Eukalyptus-like freshness

Draught, Glenfiddich Warehouse # 68, Stockholm, Sweden.  Appears darker than expected, a rich bronze-almost brown colored beer with full foam.  Juicy hop nose with sweet malts.  Quite a lot of depth in the yeast and malt components, producing a variety of fruit flavors.  Not a lot of describable hop character, but present.  Finishes clean and lasts well in the mouth.  My first Narke beer.  Extremely high in quality.
Fad. Mørk øl med et fint skum. Rigtig god humlet duft og en fin balance, der virkelig lægger op til en overordentlig god sessionbeer. Virkelig solidt håndværk der varmt kan anbefales.
On tap @ Bishops Arms, Karlstad. Good as usual from Närke Kulturbryggeri, a very good bitter that i really would like to drink more of. Nutty and butterscotch flavors. Very enjoyable!

On tap at Bishops Arms, Stockholm. Hazy copper with a medium offwhite head. Grassy hop aroma with hints of toffee and berries. Flavours are very bitter indeed, the touches of berries and toffee provides just a little softening touch. Medium body. No reason to be bitter with such a beer.

Tap @ Den Tatoverede Enke, Cph.
Pours clear, deep mahogany red, with a pretty nice, creamy off-white head. Great duration and nice lacing. Great caramel aroma with lots of pleasant pine hops. Wonderful creamy mouthfeel. Stunning flavour. First a dose of sweet strawberries, grapefruit, lots of dry and bitter pine hops. Super chewy and wonderful balance.

Draught. Hazy dark amber colour. Aroma is some resin and pine needles together with some malty bread. Flavour is just like aroma - some resin, pine needles and some malty bread. Some bitterness in the finish.

Unclear amber with a lasting creamy off-white head. Fruity aroma with blackcurrant, winegum and herbs. Fruity sweet flavour, some hop flavour and a bitter, dry finish. Rather strong carbonation which adds to an impression of an American beer, with English hops

From tap at the at Den tatoverede Enke. Pours dark amber to brown with a dense off-white head. Light fruity aroma with a mild mouldy note. Flavour is slight fruity. The mouldy note reappears in the flavour. Dry and bitter flavour into the finish. Tart fruity note with a distinct acidic touch in the finish.

Draught. Bit pale dark red-amber colour with a short lasting headleaving a fair lacing. Fresh aroma of bitter hops, malt and caramel. Very nice fresh bitter hoppiness in the flavour with fruits and malt. Good lasting dry bitter finish.

Draft at Bishops Arms, Karlstad.
Came up very muddy (chill haze?). Impressive cinamon-coloured head.Solid nose of blackberries and nutty malt. Quite oily mouthfeel and moderate bitter finish. Easy drinking bitter.

Draught. Medium high creamy off-white head. Clear cobber body. Hops dominated and bitter aroma. Light and mild fruity and yet bitter flavor with a bit of caramel as well. Low carbonation. Short aftertaste.

Draught at Den Tatoverede Enke.
Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate. Nice bitter.
Draught at "den tatoverede enke". Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is dark amber. Aroma and taste are rich with hops and malt. Bitter finish.

Bottle, nice clear bronze with a thick manilla head. Pear, earthy resinous hops and a little cedar in the nose. Flavor has notes up front of dark toffee/caramel, earthy hops and a woody presence. Pretty resinous and bitter. Medium bodied along with a lively carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2009 On-tap at Bishops Arms, Järntorget, Gothenburg. Hazy amber color with a creamy off-white head. Hoppy floral and citrus like aroma also some sweet fruit and caramel. Tastes hoppy, bitter, fruity/sweet, caramel. Very nice one!

081122. Cask. Örebro Öl & Whisky Festival. A bit more grassier and more lightbodied.

500mL bottle, courtesy of omhper.  Thanks, Per!  Pours a murky orangish-brown color; fluffy, khaki-colored head with excellent retention and lacing.  Floral and fruity hops in the aroma; some cedar and mate tea (thanks, Eben) and red fruits; quite pleasant, if a little overripe.  A zest of grassy and herbal hops at the front; definitely get that mate / tea-like malt character at the core; a good twist on the typical earthy, biscuity ESB, with a bit more very ripe red fruit.  Medium, biscuity and earthy finish.

Poured from a 500 ml.  Golden orange hue, fairly hazy but still clear.  Sweet and grassy aroma of yerba mate, graham, and orange.  Tea extends itself indefinitely with a light hint of cherry syrup.  Crisp, understated bitterness of grass and sesame seed; certainly heavy and perhaps overly so on EKG.  Lightly nutty, very leafy, long resinous character and the softest shade of honey.  Bright fruit sugar darts in and out, suggesting cotton candy.  Mild astringency finishes.  More or less an uninteresting hoppy pale type.  Thanks for sharing, Ken!

courtesy of Per Forsgren - dark amber colour with a little persistent beige foam; very hoppy, aroma of herbs, mint and gentian; some red fruits, medium-bodied and very bitter, dry and long bitter herbal and fruity finish - complex and very good
Draught at Stockholm Beer FestivalAmber colour, OK head. Dusty hop aroma. Hoppy bitterness with notes of toffee.
Draught. Whisky/cola-coloured with a thin head. Taste of old oak boards with a dry finish of wild strawberries. Very dry and very good.
Full malty beer with just the right amount of bitterenss to make the balance. Long lingering taste.
Bottle RBESG 07 ... Brown ... High hop ... fruity high hop ... by now my palate has been truly shot , so my descriptionsgo down hill :-( score are still a good gide to my self at least for retrys.
Bottle at RBESG 2007.  Red amber with lasting beige head.  Odd fruit, cakey aroma, dry malt.  Bit of odd sickly something.  Odd.  Some smoke/ashtray.

Bottle, RBESG Grand Tasting 07. Copper, thin off-white head. Nose is funky sherberty fresh hops. Some malt as not to overpower. Mouth is warm, yeasty fresh bread, malty, some fruit. Excellent. Finishes bitter and coating. Really loved this.

A Mes rate: 
Bottle at RBESG. Slightly hazy dark brown with a reasonable off white head. Really pleasant Swedish take on an English style beer. Very cascade aroma with some balancing malt underneath. Biscuity and bready malt flavour with earth notes finally balanced out with a bitter finish. Enjoyed it.
Draught. Dark red with white head. Hops and floral, fruity notes. Some metal as well but not much. Medium body.

Drought @ The Rover-Göteborg.
Dark red amber colour,flat head. Aroma of hops,,dust,fruits,and a gain a nice hopy nose. Flavor has a smouth mouthfeeeling of fruits,hops.Thin to medium body,and a medium fruity/hopy finish.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2010 Draught @ The Rover, Göteborg. Dark brown body with a beige head. Aroma has malt and hops. Flavor is relatively mild malty with a balanced bitterness. Not to specially, but a fine clean and well balanced bitter.

Draught- Dark brown with beige head. Sweet, spicy aroma of malt and something rather weird. Cant put my finger (or nose in this case) on it. Sweet flavour with a light spicyness and maybe some dirty wasg cloth? Could this be the aroma? We were discussing, if this beer was in the beginning of being infected in some way, but it wasnt the same bad aroma or flavour as one would typically find. Maybe it was or maybe it was just me - this beer just didnt do it for me.
Hazy brown of color with a creamy offwihte head. Notes of malt in the aroma and hops. A ok flavor of malt and notes of hops.

Draught, The Rover  Dark amber, enormous beige head., extremely tight and compact. English, rather toasty malt nose feels rather different from the very american hop oriented bottle version that seemed loaded with cascades. The dominant hops are obviously american though, but I read that Goldings are involved. Pretty biscuity anyway and limited in its sweetness despite the fair body. Efficient hops develop a comfortable bitterness with grapefruit tones everywhere. Slight earthiness completes the mineral character from the apparently burtonised water. leafy bitterness, salty feel. Medium-full bodied. Well done.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2007 Draught at Bishops Arms, Östra Hamngatan, Göteborg, Sweden. Hazy reddish brown, small but firm off-white head. Fruity toffeish malt aroma, with pines, apricots, and grapefruit in the hop profile. Medium bodied and very smooth. Very well balanced with a long bitter finish. Very good.
On tap at Rover. Dark amber with a medium tan head. Caramel and hoppy tones. Malty and fruity. medium body with a nice bitter finish.
rbesg06, on tap at the rover. purple with a slight white head. plummy aroma, very flat with some firm, calcified water, prickly bitter finish. classy stuff

Draught. Nice ruby red coloured body under a huge frothy head. Aromatic hops. Delicate citrus succulence taste with a lingering bitter finish. Depth and rounded palate (Served chilled at Glenfiddich Warehouse No 68 in Stockholm. Thanks to Omhper for the recommendation, 30.11.2006).
On tap at Glenfiddich Warehouse No 68 Stockholm 30 Nov 2006. Dark brown coloured. A small head. Fruity aroma. Malty flavour with fruity hints. A cautious bitter aftertaste.
DraughtBrown color, nice lace; light aroma of malt and fruits. Good malty body, medium structure, very good yet subtle fruitness, elegant hopping, caramel. Imagine a fruity Dubbel Impressive.

On tap at Den Tatoverede Enke. Brown reddish in colour with a medium sized head. Now this is really yummy. Really wellbalanced with a nice complexity. Refreshing and powerfull in both aroma and flavour at the same time.

On tap at The Rover, Göteborg. Copper coloured, low head. Nice nutty and hoppy aroma, notes of toffee and grapefruit. Hoppy flavour on a decent malty base, grapefruity elements, "dusty" hops in the finish, bitter aftertaste. A bitter well above average.
Draught. Dark ruby red colour with mediumsized beige head. Aroma is flowery hops and grass. Flavour is hoppy with some hints of maizeish sweetness. Quiter standard bitter.
Serious hoppy aroma, grassy and citruit. Taste is similarly hoppy with a balancing biscuityness.

Draught at "Den Tatoverede Enke". Clear red/brown - very big fluffy head, almost like an icecream. It took about 10 minutes pour it. Redberries, roasted malts, nice medium hopped. Light bitterness. Dry finish.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2007 (Draught, Rover - Göteborg, may 2006)
The beer has a big, light and fluffy head. Dark red amber-coloured liquid.
It smells like butter,
 and soft shampoo. Banana-candy. Hazelnut. Malt. Unsweetened plum. Raspberry.
The taste is creamy, medium body. Finished with unsweetened plum and a big bitterness. A bit salty. Unique in it´s style.Second try: Lovely aroma of raspberries, lemon/grapefruit with a light floral sting. Tiny roasted. Notes of plums. Very clean flavour with flowers, some chocolate and caramel with hints of raspberries. Medium body. Very nice.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm) Colour is dark brown, mahogany, with a firm frothy head. Nose is mainly malty, with caramel and some suppressed hoppy notes. Taste is malty, with caramel, hints of dried fruit (apricots, prunes) and a nice fresh, hoppy taste throughout. The hops are more evident in the taste than in the nose. Very nice and refreshing. Probably the least complex of the Närke brews, but one helluva "mainstream" ale.

Slight gushing to pinkish-yellowish, absurdely huge head over clear deep amber-foxy beer. Woody, chocolate but also solvent, and a good dose of it. Noble hops seeping through. Wry, tannine-rich and well-hopped very dry bitter. Good hops, giving as much flavour as bitterness. Very vague background caramel. Dry-out effect, severe, not much body, OTOH thirstquenching. Good ESB, bit severe, but rather drinkable all the same; thanks to the Scandinavian crew.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2008 First try: Draught, pint. The Rover (Gothenburg, Sweden) on February 5, 2006.
A dark amber colored fresh micro brew. The more I taste from this brewery, the more impressed I get.
Very hoppy and fruity, not too much carbon dioxide, the way it should be in a bitter.8/4/8/4/17
Second try: Draught at Bishops Arms in Örebro, Sweden.Dark brown color with a creamy brown head. Citrus like hoppy scent. Very hoppy citrus taste. Nice fruity initial taste and good bitterness. Mild lasting fruity aftertaste.8/4/9/4/17=4.2Third rating(Draught at The Rover, Göteborg)On March 1, 2008Slight shady dark copper color, thick tan head. Fruity, hoppy and sweet scent. Bitter, fruity and sweet atste. Medium mouthfeel, high bitterness.6/4/8/3/14=3.5
Bottle. Amber colour with a tanned head. Hoppy aroma with some hints of malt in the background. Flavor of roasted malts and leaves you with a nice hoppy aftertaste.

Amber, low carbonation, tanned creamy head.
Piney and grassy aroma.
Butterscotch, pine and grass. Light body, grassy aftertaste.

Bottle at RBESG grand tasting, August 2005. Good hoppy aroma, with plenty of resinous notes. Hoppy again on the palate, this time with some more earthy edges. Solid, underlying dry malt base, although some residual sweetness comes through. A well balanced and well made beer.

(Bottled) Slightly hazy dark amber color with a small head. Dark-fruity, aromatic-hoppy aroma with roasted malt and smoky hints. Smoky, roasty, malty flavor with late, smooth, dryish bitterness. Medium to full-bodied palate with smooth carbonation. A nice and full, warming bitter.

On tap at The Rover, Gothenburg. 
Amber, with small beige head. Low on carbonation. Grapefruit in aroma. Flavor is mild, with floral elements and hops.
(051008)

Honeylike sweetness with herbal hop character in the nose.  Clear amber-copper coloured body with fine bubbled, dense, off white head that lasts well and laces.  Moderately bitter, floral, leafy hop flavour over toasty malt base.  Dry, light body with rather strong and lively carbonation.  Bottle sampled at RBESG 2005.

Sampled at RBESG 2005.Dark amber colored with a thin off-white head. Lots of hop, grass and earth in the aroma with characters of a pale ale. Bitter hoppy flavor, earthly tones. Dry specially in the end. Sparkling. Nice.

Well I suppose Id better start getting around to inputting the ratings from my trip to Scandinavia, so here goes. On draught at Akkurat. Chestnut with a white head. Aroma was moerately sweet with a bit of nuttiness as well. However, the flavour profile was a mirror image of what the aroma would suggest. There was a thin malt presence and it was indeed very hoppy and bitter. This was my first ever Swedish beer and a very good introduction it was.
An amber beer with a light brown head. The aroma is sweet with notes of caramel and hops. The flavor is hoppy - my guess is Goldings, which gives it a slight dusty flavor.

Draught, at The Rover. Dark red with little white head, almost diminishing, good lacings. Aroma moderate malty (roasted) and moderate/heavy hoppy (flowers). Flavor light sweet, moderate/heavy bitter, long duration. Light to medium body, oily, flat carbonated.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2006 Bottle. Brown colour with a baige head. Malty barnyard hoppy aroma and a hay bitter taste. Medium body and a light bitter dry finish. 5-3-5-3-12
Re-Rate.
Draught at den Tatoverede Enke. Dark amber colour with a huge beautyfull beige head. Sweet malty, fruity aroma and taste. Medium body with a sweet bitter dry finish. 6-5-7-3-15

Bottled at RBESG 2005.
Cloudy orange coloured with an off white head.
Sweet malty aroma with notes of hops and pine needles.
Flavour of malts, hops and pine needles.
Nice ESB.
Bottle. Nice clean bitter. Nice earthy hops character, citrusy/leafy. Some nice bitterness in the finish. Nice fresh, balanced flavour. Nice one.

(Bottle 50 cl) Clear, dark amber with a small, off-white head. The typical, fresh Närke aromatic, hoppy nose. Light caramel malt but almost drowned by an overwhelming bitterness. This one was not in balance in my humble opinion. 120805
Amber coloured, thin white head. Hoppy nose with an herbal touch. Citric, hoppy flavour with some hints of butterscotch. Refreshing. Great bitterness.

(on bottle at RBESG 2005)Ambergolden colour, white head. very high hopping with some OK hops, noce though. frash taste, but still mild mouthfeel, fits good within the style. Grassy-sweet finisk, very drinkable.
UPDATED: AUG 15, 2005 Bottled @ RBESG2005: Reddish brown coloured. Clear. Off white head. Hoppy flowery aroma. Some sweet notes. Flavour is herbal and fruity. Is quite dry. Is fruity in the end.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2009 Bottled @RBESG05
Copper brown, small white head, some lace. Flowery hoppy nose. Medium-bodied. Very flowery hoppy, good malt character in the background. Short hoppy aftertaste. (7/4/8/4/16 3.9).

Draught at The Rover, Gotehnburg, Sweden.
Redbrown with a bubbly, beige head.
Flowery hoppiness and some toffee in both aroma and flavour.

(Samled draught at Ardbeg Room, Stockholm) Hazy reddish brown colour, rich, firm, rocky head. Aromatic flowery hoppy aroma of grapefruit and cedar wood. Sweet notes of toffee and blue plums. UPDATED: OCT 11, 2006 Copper/amber color, nice offwhite head. Floral aroma with elder, citrus and grapefruit. Very floral flavor, elder is there as well, dry and hoppy, and that hops growe stronger in the finish. I liked this one...
Medium head. God colour. Very cold. Couldnt get a grip on it. Icebitter. Maybe because of the weather.

Draught at Ardbeg Room, Stockholm.  
Dark copper colour, rich firm head. Juicy grapefruity hop aroma. Sweet and richly malty, some cookie malt, near full bodied. The mouthfeel is on the clean side. Its very hoppy, but has sufficient malt to balance it. Very bitter finish.

Keg @ The Ardbeg Room, StockholmDark brown colour. Served ice cold. After a few minutes of hand aided warm up one could find some malty aroma with a touch of black currant. Full bodied malt sweetness with a dry flowery finish. The long aftertaste gives away the probable use of a small dose of smoked malt in the mash. (Note to self: Check that with the brewer) It leaves you with a somewhat sticky sweetness on your lips. Scottish/american in style to me.

On draught at The Rover, Göteborg. 
Mahogany colour. Fruity backbone. Raisin, cigarette-ashes, bit phenolic. Still clean in mouthfeel. Thorough bitterness. Body seemed a bit light.
